intro: Polygonum aviculare var. agrestinum, commonly known as field knotweed, is a flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are usually pink to reddish in color. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a smooth or slightly toothed margin. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks.
